channel.title: [Arthies] Global Object System showoff
channel.description:
[b]Project:[/b] Arthies [b]Programmer:[/b] RandQm [b]Server base:[/b] Delta
If you log in or enter the region after an object is changed/added, you'll not be able to see it in that state. So I decided to wrote a system to handle that. If you login or change region or whatever, the object will be visible for all players in its current state. I also want to point out that; firemaking, woodcutting, mining ect... is all using my object system, it is not using any private methods for the object state changes, timers, ect.. showoff in the video:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1S7wdUyB3A&feature=youtu.be[/youtube]
I'd like to have some feedback on this, *not on my woodcutting I know it has to be redone.* what do you think of it? what things could also make the players see the object in it's original state instead of the current state, so I can fix that to.
[b]I will be regularly updating this thread soon, to showoff more of my work. Stay tuned![/b]

item.title: [Arthies] Global Object System showoff
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Project: Arthies
Programmer: RandQm
Server base: Delta

If you log in or enter the region after an object is changed/added, you’ll not be able to see it in that state.
So I decided to wrote a system to handle that.
If you login or change region or whatever, the object will be visible for all players in its current state.
I also want to point out that; firemaking, woodcutting, mining ect… is all using my object system,
it is not using any private methods for the object state changes, timers, ect…
showoff in the video:

[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1S7wdUyB3A&feature=youtu.be[/youtube]

I’d like to have some feedback on this, not on my woodcutting I know it has to be redone.
what do you think of it?
what things could also make the players see the object in it’s original state instead of the current state, so I can fix that to.

I will be regularly updating this thread soon, to showoff more of my work. Stay tuned!

Read full topic
